item.content:encoded: Graphic: Pete Volk/Polygon | Source images: Various 2023 set a high bar for video game releases, and 2024 looks no different 2023 was, you could say, an interesting year for video games. It unleashed a metric ton of genre-defining, record-breaking new classics, including The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom and Baldur‚Äôs Gate 3, but was also one of the most devastating layoff periods for gaming companies in recent history. There‚Äôs no telling what precise delights or horrors lay waiting in ...

item.content:encoded: Image: Nintendo In a series that‚Äôs (almost) all classics, which of Link‚Äôs adventures is best? Throughout 2023, in honor of the magnificent Tears of the Kingdom, Polygon has been celebrating Nintendo‚Äôs Legend of Zelda series. It‚Äôs been fascinating. Perhaps no other video game series is so rewarding to revisit, or presents such wildly different, refracted visions of its core idea ‚Äî which nevertheless remains consistent throughout. Pok√©mon has found its new star, and that glittering beacon is a round yellow duck with chronic headaches. Psyduck is the scene-stealing pal of Pok√©mon Concierge, a new stop-motion animated Pok√©mon series from Netflix and dwarf studios. Games Bad decisions, failed plans, and fierce debates Video games run the gamut from silly toys for babies to life-altering works of art, all of which make up an industry that rakes in billions of dollars a year. Of course, the endlessly consumptive nature of the business can‚Äôt help but produce controversy, and 2023 had its share of milestones. Let‚Äôs look back at some of the most dra...

item.content:encoded: Image: Mimimi Games One of 2023‚Äôs best DLCs is also a bittersweet goodbye Mimimi Games didn‚Äôt set out to make a trilogy of stealth strategy games. But once the studio shut its doors in December, after the release of its final DLC pack and content update for Shadow Gambit: The Cursed Crew, a trilogy of stealth strategy games is the prevailing legacy it left behind. ‚ÄúIf I had had the chance to continue, I think we would have tried to pivot ‚Äî to try to do something else,‚Äù Moritz Wagner, Mimimi‚Äôs ...

item.content:encoded: Image: Owlcat Games There are fewer quest-breaking bugs in the Warhammer 40K CRPG Owlcat Games continues its work on Warhammer 40,000: Rogue Trader, this time with a patch aimed at rectifying some nagging problems. item.title: Evaluating Methods for Calculating Document Similarity | KDnuggets
item.description: The blog covers methods for representing documents as vectors and computing similarity, such as Jaccard similarity, Euclidean distance, cosine similarity, and cosine similarity with TF-IDF, along with...
item.content:encoded: The blog covers methods for representing documents as vectors and computing similarity, such as Jaccard similarity, Euclidean distance, cosine similarity, and cosine similarity with TF-IDF, along with pre-processing steps for text data, such as tokenization, lowercasing, removing punctuation, removing stop words, and lemmatization.

item.title: Easily Integrate LLMs into Your Scikit-learn Workflow with Scikit-LLM | KDnuggets
item.description: LLM is a powerful model that could improve our text analysis. With Scikit-LLM, we could integrate the LLM easily into our ML pipeline.
item.content:encoded: LLM is a powerful model that could improve our text analysis. With Scikit-LLM, we could integrate the LLM easily into our ML pipeline.

item.title: VideoPoet: A large language model for zero-shot video generation | Google AI Blog
item.description: Posted by Dan Kondratyuk and David Ross, Software Engineers, Google Research A recent wave of video generation models has burst onto the scene, in many cases showcasing stunning picturesque qualit...
item.content:encoded: Posted by Dan Kondratyuk and David Ross, Software Engineers, Google Research A recent wave of video generation models has burst onto the scene, in many cases showcasing stunning picturesque quality. One of the current bottlenecks in video generation is in the ability to produce coherent large motions. In many cases, even the current leading models either generate small motion or, when producing larger motions, exhibit noticeable artifacts. To explore the application of language models in vi...

item.content:encoded: Posted by Yechen Li and Neha Arora, Software Engineers, Google Research Fifteen minutes. That‚Äôs how long it took to empty the Colosseum, an engineering marvel that‚Äôs still standing as the largest amphitheater in the world. Two thousand years later, this design continues to work well to move enormous crowds out of sporting and entertainment venues. But of course, exiting the arena is only the first step. Next, people must navigate the traffic that builds up in the surrounding streets. Th...
